                                                                   Section A

     Question                                       Answers                                                   Notes                     Total
1.     a    i                                                                                 Must cut CH2–CO bond AND enclose all
                                                                                              of the –COOH group.

                                                                                                                                          1




1.     a    ii   Any two of:                                                                  Accept “hydrophilic part/group forms
                 –COOH/CO/OH/carboxylate/carboxyl/hydroxyl/hydroxy group forms hydrogen       hydrogen bonds/H-bonds to water”.
                 bonds/H-bonds to water ✔                                                     Accept “hydrophobic section” instead of
                                                                                              “hydrocarbon chain”.
                 London/dispersion/instantaneous induced dipole-induced dipole forces occur
                 between hydrocarbon chains ✔                                                 Award [1 max] for answers based on        2 max
                                                                                              “the –COOH group being polar AND the
                 hydrocarbon chain cannot form hydrogen bonds/H-bonds to water ✔              hydrocarbon chain being non-polar”.
                 strong hydrogen bonds/H-bonds between water molecules exclude hydrocarbon
                 chains «from the body of the water» ✔
                                                                          –4–                                      M18/4/CHEMI/SP3/ENG/TZ1/XX/M


     Question                                            Answers                                                   Notes                 Total
1.     b    i     Above about 240 cm2:                                                           For both M1 and M2 accept “particles”
                  greater collision frequency/collisions per second between «palmitic acid»      for “molecules”.
                  molecules and the barrier «as area reduced» ✔                                  For M1 accept “space/area between
                                                                                                 molecules reduced” OR “molecules
                                                                                                 moving closer together”.
                  At less than about 240 cm2:
                  molecules completely cover the surface
                  OR                                                                                                                      2
                  there is no space between molecules
                  OR
                  force from movable barrier transmitted directly through the molecules to the
                  fixed barrier
                  OR
                  «palmitic acid» molecules are pushed up/down/out of layer ✔

1.     b    ii    amount of acid  «5.0  105 dm3  0.0034 mol dm3»  1.7  107 «mol» ✔       Award [2] for correct final answer.
                                                                                                                                          2
                  number of molecules  «1.7  107 mol  6.02  1023 mol1 » 1.0  1017 ✔      Award [1] for “1.0  1020”.

1.     b    iii             240 cm2
                  «area                 » 2.4  1015 «cm2» ✔
                            1.0  1017                                                                                                    1
                                                                             –5–                                            M18/4/CHEMI/SP3/ENG/TZ1/XX/M


     Question                                           Answers                                                             Notes                      Total
2.     a          CaCO3 (s)  2HCl (aq)  CaCl2 (aq)  CO2 (g)  H2O (l) ✔                                 Accept “CO2 (aq)”.                           1
2.     b          measure the volume of gas at different times «plot a graph and extrapolate»              Accept other techniques that yield data
                  OR                                                                                       which can be plotted and extrapolated.
                                                                                                                                                        1
                  measure the mass of the reaction mixture at different times «plot a graph and
                  extrapolate» ✔
2.     c    i     method 2 AND marble is in excess «so a little extra has little effect»                   Accept, as a reason, that “as the mass
                  OR                                                                                       is greater the percentage variation will
                                                                                                           be lower”.
                  large chips AND marble is in excess «so a little extra has little effect»
                  OR                                                                                                                                    1
                  method 2 AND HCl is limiting reagent «so a little extra marble has little effect»
                  OR
                  large chips AND HCl is limiting reagent «so a little extra marble has little effect» ✔
2.     c    ii    surface area                                                                             Accept “shape of the chip”.
                  OR                                                                                                                                    1
                  purity «of the marble» ✔
2.     d    i     variation of individual values is much greater «than this uncertainty»
                  OR                                                                                                                                    1
                  «uncertainty» does not take into account «student» reaction time ✔
2.     d    ii        121.96 s
                  «             60.98 s »  61«s» ✔                                                                                                    1
                         2
2.     d    iii   systematic AND always makes the time shorter «than the actual value»                     Accept, as reason, “it always affects the
                  OR                                                                                       value in the same direction” OR “the
                                                                                                           error is consistent”.
                  systematic AND it is an error in the method used «not an individual measurement»                                                      1
                  OR
                  systematic AND more repetitions would not reduce the error ✔
                                                                        –6–                      M18/4/CHEMI/SP3/ENG/TZ1/XX/M


                                                                    Section B
Option A — Materials

      Question                                       Answers                                     Notes                 Total
 3.     a         «close packed» lattice of metal atoms/ions ✔
                                                                                                                         2
                  no spaces for water molecules to pass though the structure ✔

 3.     b    i    composite ✔                                                                                            1

 3.     b    ii   melting point                                                  Accept “colour/transparency”.
                  OR
                  permeability
                  OR
                  density
                  OR
                  conductivity                                                                                           1
                  OR
                  elasticity/stiffness
                  OR
                  brittleness/flexibility
                  OR
                  «tensile» strength ✔

(Question 3b continued)

      Question                                        Answers                                              Notes                      Total
 3.     b    iii   Any three of:                                                         Accept “ethanol” or specific
                                                                                         hydrocarbons.
                   hydrocarbon/carbon-containing gas/compound ✔
                                                                                         Accept “N2”, “H2”, “NH3” or specific inert
                   mixed with inert gas ✔                                                gases.
                   heat/high temperature ✔                                               Accept temperature or range within           3 max
                                                                                                   
                   «transition» metal catalyst ✔                                         600–800 C.
                   hydrocarbon/carbon compound decomposes to form carbon «nanotubes» ✔   Accept specific metals such as Ni, Co or
                                                                                         Fe.
                   nanotubes form on catalyst surface ✔

 3.     b    iv    rod shaped molecules ✔                                                                                               1
                                                                      –8–                                     M18/4/CHEMI/SP3/ENG/TZ1/XX/M


     Question                                       Answers                                                  Notes                       Total
4.     a         soften/melt when heated                                                    Accept “low melting point” OR “can be
                 OR                                                                         moulded when heated”.
                                                                                                                                          1
                 can be melted and moulded ✔

4.     b    i    both have «long» hydrocarbon chains                                        Accept “CH2 –CH2 units”.
                 OR
                 both have chains comprising CH2 units ✔                                                                                  2

                 HDPE has little/no branching AND LDPE has «more» branching ✔               Accept “HDPE more crystalline”.

4.     b    ii   HDPE is more rigid/less flexible                                           Accept “HDPE has lower ductility”.
                 OR
                 HDPE has a higher melting point                                                                                          1
                 OR
                 HDPE has greater «tensile» strength ✔

4.     c    i    form «temporary» activated complexes/reaction intermediates ✔              Accept “consumed in one reaction/step
                                                                                            AND regenerated in a later reaction/step”.
                                                                                                                                          1
                                                                                            Accept “provides alternative mechanism”.

4.     c    ii   inductively coupled plasma/ICP spectroscopy using mass spectroscopy/mass   Accept “atomic absorption/aa
                 spectrometry/MS/ICP-MS                                                     spectroscopy” or “MS/mass-
                                                                                            spectroscopy/mass spectrometry”.
                 OR                                                                                                                       1
                 inductively coupled plasma/ICP spectroscopy using optical emission
                 spectroscopy/OES/ICP-OES ✔
                                                                          –9–                                        M18/4/CHEMI/SP3/ENG/TZ1/XX/M


     Question                                         Answers                                                         Notes                    Total
4.     d        Any two of:                                                                          Accept other valid factors such as
                many types «of plastics» exist                                                       thermal decomposition of some plastics,
                                                                                                     production of toxic fumes, etc.
                OR
                «plastics» require sorting «by type» ✔
                                                                                                                                                2

                «plastics» need to be separated from non-plastic materials
                OR
                «often» composites/moulded on/bound to non-plastic/other components ✔

4.     e        «different classifications are appropriate for» different properties/applications/
                purposes ✔                                                                                                                      1




5.              ratio of electrons : aluminium ions  3 : 1 ✔                                        Award [3] for correct final answer.

                               1.296  1013 C
                amount Al «                    »  4.48  107 «mol» ✔                                                                           3
                              96500 Cmol1  3
                mass Al « 4.48  107 mol  26.98 g mol1»  1.21  109 «g» ✔

                 OR

     Question                                        Answers                                                Notes                   Total
6.     b         Phenylalanine and valine:
                 London/dispersion/instantaneous induced dipole-induced dipole forces   Do not accept dipole-dipole interactions.
                 OR
                 permanent dipole-induced dipole «interactions» ✔                                                                    2

                 Glutamine and asparagine:
                 hydrogen bonds ✔

6.     c    i    hydrolysis ✔                                                                                                        1

6.     c    ii   compare Rf with known amino acids                                      Accept “from Rf”.
                 OR                                                                                                                  1
                 compare distance moved with known amino acids ✔



7.     a    i    hydrolytic «rancidity» ✔                                               Accept a formula for ester group.
                 ester group ✔                                                                                                       2



7.     a    ii   «presence of» moisture/water
                 OR
                 «increase in» temperature                                              Accept “heat”.
                 OR                                                                                                                  1
                 «presence of» enzymes/bacteria/fungi/mould
                 OR
                 low pH/«presence of» acid ✔
                                                                         – 12 –                                  M18/4/CHEMI/SP3/ENG/TZ1/XX/M


     Question                                         Answers                                                     Notes                      Total
7.     b         «stearic acid» straight chain/chain has no kinks/more regular structure
                 OR
                 «stearic acid» saturated/no «carbon–carbon» double bonds ✔                      Accept “«stearic acid» greater surface
                                                                                                 area/electron density”.
                                                                                                                                               3
                 «stearic acid» chains pack more closely together ✔
                 stronger London/dispersion/instantaneous induced dipole-induced dipole forces
                 «between molecules» ✔

7.     c    i    lowers risk of heart disease/atherosclerosis
                 OR
                 lowers LDL cholesterol
                 OR
                 increases HDL cholesterol                                                                                                     1
                 OR
                 aids brain/neurological development «in children»
                 OR
                 relieves rheumatoid arthritis ✔

7.     c    ii   soluble AND non-polar hydrocarbon chain ✔                                       Accept as reasons “«predominantly»
                                                                                                 non-polar” OR “long hydrocarbon               1
                                                                                                 chain”.

                                                                                                                                          (continued)
                                                                           – 13 –                              M18/4/CHEMI/SP3/ENG/TZ1/XX/M


(Question 7c continued)

      Question                                          Answers                                                Notes                    Total
 7.     c    iii   not biodegradable                                                           Accept “stored/accumulate in bodies of
                                                                                               prey/animals eaten”.
                   OR
                                                                                               Accept “not excreted”.
                   stored/accumulate in fat ✔
                                                                                                                                         2
                   biomagnification occurs
                   OR
                   concentration increases along food chain ✔

 7.     c    iv    add starch/cellulose/carbohydrates/additives/catalysts «to plastic during   Accept reference to biodegradable
                   manufacture to allow digestion by micro-organisms»                          plastics other than PLA; for example
                                                                                               polyhydroxyalkanoates (PHA),
                   OR
                                                                                               poly(butylene succinate) (PBS),
                   replace traditional plastics with polylactic acid/PLA-based ones            polybutylene adipate terephthalate        1
                   OR                                                                          (PBAT) and polycaprolactone (PCL).

                   blend traditional and polylactic acid/PLA-based plastics ✔

     Question                                        Answers                                          Notes                 Total
8.     a        «-1,4-»glycosidic ✔                                                Accept «-1,4-»glycoside.
                                                                                                                             1
                                                                                    Accept “ether”.

8.     b        Glucose:
                readily passes through intestine wall/dissolves in blood
                OR
                is immediately available for energy/respiration
                OR
                transported rapidly around body ✔                                                                            2


                Starch:
                must be hydrolysed/broken down «into smaller molecules» first ✔

Option C — Energy

      Question                                        Answers                                                     Notes                      Total
 9.     a                      Gas                                  Source
                  methane/CH4 ✔                  animals
                                                 OR
                                                 anaerobic decomposition of organic waste
                                                 OR
                                                 bogs/marshes/rice paddies ✔                                                                 2 max
                  nitrogen(I) oxide/dinitrogen   bacterial action                                Accept “nitrous oxide”.
                  monoxide/N2O ✔                 OR
                                                 combustion of biomass ✔
                  ozone/O3 ✔                     effect of UV light on oxygen/O2 ✔               Accept “electrical discharges/lightning”.


 9.     b        CO2 (aq)  H2O (l)  H (aq)  HCO3 (aq) ✔                                     Accept CO2 (aq)  H2O (l)  2H (aq) 
                                                                                                 CO32(aq).
                 OR                                                                                                                            1
                 CO2 (aq)  H2O (l)  H2CO3 (aq) AND H2CO3 (aq)  H (aq) 
                                                                        
                                                                                  HCO3 (aq) ✔   Accept equations with single arrow.


 9.     c        no change in polarity/dipole «moment when molecule vibrates» ✔                  Do not accept “non-polar” or “no dipole
                                                                                                 moment” – idea of change must be              1
                                                                                                 there.

  Question                                        Answers                                  Notes                 Total
10.   a      nitrogen/N                                                     Accept “phosphorus/P”.
             OR
             oxygen/O                                                                                             1
             OR
             sulfur/S ✔

10.   b      Any three of:
             different molar masses
             OR
             different strengths of intermolecular forces ✔


             different boiling points ✔
                                                                                                                3 max

             temperature in «fractionating» column decreases upwards ✔


             «components» condense at different temperatures/heights
             OR
             «component with» lower boiling point leaves column first ✔
                                                                             – 17 –                                 M18/4/CHEMI/SP3/ENG/TZ1/XX/M


  Question                                             Answers                                                      Notes                   Total
10.   c   i                          energy released       5470 kJ mol1                           Do not accept “–47.9 «kJ g1»”.
               specific energy «                                        1
                                                                             »  47.9 «kJ g1» ✔
                                     mass consumed         114.26 g mol
                                                                                                                                             2
                                    energy released
               energy density «                     specific energy  density  47.9 kJ g–1      Do not accept “–33.7 «kJ cm3»” unless
                                   volume consum ed
                                                                                                   “–47.9 «kJ g1»” already penalized.
                0.703 g cm3 »  33.7 «kJ cm3 » ✔

10.   c   ii   energy is lost «to the surroundings» as heat/sound/friction                         Do not accept just “energy is lost”.
               OR
               energy is lost to the surroundings «as heat/sound/friction»                                                                   1
               OR
               incomplete combustion ✔



11.   a   i    viscosity «of vegetable oils is too high» ✔


               transesterification                                                                                                           2
               OR
               «conversion into» alkyl/methyl/ethyl esters ✔

11.   a   ii   R–CO–O–CH3 / RCOOMe
               OR                                                                                                                            1
               R–CO–O–C2H5 / RCOOEt ✔
                                                                         – 18 –                                      M18/4/CHEMI/SP3/ENG/TZ1/XX/M


  Question                                           Answers                                                          Notes                    Total
11.   b        «growing oil producing» plants absorbs carbon dioxide from the atmosphere            Accept “biofuels renewable” OR
               OR                                                                                   “petroleum based fuels non-renewable”.

               «combustion of» petroleum based fuels releases carbon stored «for millions of        Accept “waste vegetable oils can be          1
                                                                                                    converted to biofuels/biodiesel”.
               years» ✔
                                                                                                    Accept “biofuels do not contain sulfur”.



12.   a   i    mass spectrometry/mass spectroscopy/MS ✔                                             Accept “analysis of radiation emitted”.      1

12.   a   ii   critical mass: mass required so that «on average» each fission/reaction results in   Accept “minimum mass of fuel needed
               a further fission/reaction ✔                                                         for the reaction to be self-sustaining”.


               Any two for [2 max]:
                                                                                                                                               3 max
               neutron captured by «235U» nucleus ✔
                                                                                                    Accept answers in the form of suitable
               fission/reaction produces many neutrons/more than one neutron ✔
                                                                                                    diagrams/equations.
               if these cause further fission/reaction a chain reaction occurs ✔

12.   b        produce long lived/long half-life radioisotopes/radioactivity                        Accept “long lived/long half-life
                                                                                                    radioactive waste”.
               OR
               could be used to produce nuclear weapons                                                                                          1
               OR
               «nuclear» accidents/meltdowns can occur ✔

Option D — Medicinal chemistry

    Question                                           Answers                                                 Notes                       Total
 13.   a        Any one of:                                                                   Accept “prevents/reduces blood clots”
                                                                                              OR “blood thinner”.
                anticoagulant ✔
                lower risk of heart attack/strokes ✔                                                                                      1 max
                prevent recurrence of heart attack/stroke ✔
                prevents cancer of colon/oesophagus/stomach ✔

 13.   b   i    fraction/proportion/percentage «of administered dosage» that reaches target   Accept “the ability of the drug to be
                «part of human body»                                                          absorbed by the body” OR “the extent to
                OR                                                                            which the drug is absorbed by the body”.       1
                fraction/ proportion/percentage «of administered dosage» that reaches blood   Do not accept “the amount/quantity of
                                                                                              the drug absorbed”.
                «plasma»/systemic circulation ✔

 13.   b   ii   «intravenous» injection/IV ✔                                                  Accept “parenterally”.
                                                                                              Accept “react with alkali/NaOH” OR             1
                                                                                              “convert to ionic form/salt”.

 13.   c   i    One absorption found in both spectra:                                         Award [1 max] if candidate states bonds
                Any one of:                                                                   (CO in both, O–H in salicylic acid only)
                                                                                              but doesn’t quote wavelength ranges.
                1050–1410 cm–1 «C–O in alcohols, esters, ethers» ✔
                1700–1750 cm–1 «CO in carboxylic acids, esters» ✔
                2500–3000 cm–1 «O–H in carboxylic acids» ✔                                                                                2 max
                2850–3090 cm–1 «C–H in alkanes, alkenes, arenes» ✔


                One absorption found in only one of the spectra:                              Accept a second/additional absorption at
                3200–3600 cm–1 «O–H in alcohols, phenols» ✔                                   1700–1750 cm–1 from the CO in ester.

(Question 13c continued)

    Question                                            Answers                                            Notes                    Total
 13.   c    ii    Any two of:
                  ring is «sterically» strained
                  OR
                  ring breaks up/opens/reacts «easily»
                  OR
                  amide/amido group «in ring» is «highly» reactive ✔


                  «irreversibly» binds/bonds to enzyme/transpeptidase                     Award [1 max] for “interferes with
                  OR                                                                      cell wall production”.                   2 max

                  inhibits enzyme/transpeptidase «in bacteria» that produces cell walls
                  OR                                                                      Do not accept “cell membrane” instead
                                                                                          of “cell wall”.
                  prevents cross-linking of bacterial cell walls ✔


                  cells absorb water AND burst
                  OR
                  cells cannot reproduce ✔


                                                                                                                               (continued…)
                                                                            – 21 –                             M18/4/CHEMI/SP3/ENG/TZ1/XX/M


(Question 13c continued)

    Question                                              Answers                                               Notes                     Total
 13.   c    iii   Any two of:
                  leads to «bacterial» resistance/proportion of resistant bacteria increases
                  OR
                  leads to penicillinase-producing bacteria ✔
                                                                                                                                          2 max
                  damage to/contamination of bodies of water/ecosystems ✔                      Accept “endocrine disruptor”.

                  destroys useful/beneficial bacteria ✔                                        Do not accept “increased cost
                                                                                               of developing antibiotics”.
                  destroyed bacteria replaced by more harmful bacteria ✔

 13.   c    iv    modify side chain ✔                                                                                                       1

 13.   d    i     temporarily bind to/block/interfere with receptor sites in brain
                  OR                                                                                                                        1
                  prevent transmission of pain impulses within CNS/central nervous system ✔

 13.   d    ii    codeine has a wider therapeutic window ✔                                     Accept “codeine has lower activity” OR
                                                                                               “codeine has lower risk of overdose” OR
                                                                                               “codeine is less potent” OR “codeine
                                                                                               has less side-effects”.
                                                                                               Do not accept “lower abuse potential for     1
                                                                                               codeine” OR “less addictive «than
                                                                                               morphine»” OR “codeine has a lower
                                                                                               bioavailability” OR “available without
                                                                                               prescription” OR “cheaper”.
                                                                          – 22 –                                      M18/4/CHEMI/SP3/ENG/TZ1/XX/M


  Question                                               Answers                                                      Notes                     Total
14.   a   i    MgCO3 (s)  2HCl (aq)  CO2 (g)  H2O (l)  MgCl2 (aq) ✔                              Do not accept “H2CO3”.                       1

14.   a   ii   n(HCl)  2 n(CaCO3)  2 n(MgCO3)                                                      Award [2] for correct final answer.
               OR                                                                                    Award [1 max] for correctly
                                                                                                     calculating amount of acid neutralized
                             2  0.680 «g»         2  0.080 « g»
               n(HCl)                   1
                                                                     ✔                              by just CaCO3 (0.014 «mol») or               2
                          100.09 «g mol »         84.32 « g mol1 »                                  MgCO3 (0.002 «mol»).


               «n(HCl)  0.0136 mol  0.0019 mol » 0.016 «mol» ✔
14.   b        inhibits the secretion of stomach acid/H ✔
               «active metabolites» bind «irreversibly» to «receptors of the» proton pump ✔          Accept “PPI/proton pump inhibitor”.
                                                                                                     Do not award mark for “binds to              2
                                                                                                     H2/histamine receptors”. (Ranitidine
                                                                                                     mode of action.)
                                                                                                     Accept “H+/K+ ATPase” for “proton pump”.


15.   a        blocks/inhibits neuraminidase/NA/«viral» enzyme which allows viruses to pass
               through cell membrane ✔                                                                                                            2
               prevent virus from leaving/escaping host cell «thus it cannot infect other cells» ✔
15.   b        Any one of:                                                                           Accept “low yield for
                                                                                                     extraction/conversion” OR “requires
               limited supply of star anise/plant ✔
                                                                                                     environmentally damaging solvents”.
               «star anise» takes time to grow ✔                                                                                                1 max
               time-consuming/multi-step extraction ✔
               low concentration in plant ✔
